sources.title: The Love Parade (1929) MAURICE CHEVALIERüçï JEANETTE MacDONALDüçï PRE-CODE MUSICAL
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Directed by: Ernst Lubitsch
Stars: Maurice Chevalier, Jeanette MacDonald, Lupino Lane, Eugene Pallette, Lillian Roth 
 
Step into the dazzling world of The Love Parade (1929), a sophisticated musical rom-com directed by the legendary Ernst Lubitsch. Starring the irresistible Maurice Chevalier and the radiant Jeanette MacDonald.

In the fictional kingdom of Sylvania‚Äîfamous for its light bulbs and bargain-priced electronics‚Äîthe royal cabinet is in turmoil: their Queen (MacDonald) remains unmarried. Meanwhile, Sylvania‚Äôs dashing emissary to France (Chevalier) finds himself recalled in disgrace, thanks to a string of scandalous romances. But rather than punishment, he‚Äôs met with an unexpected proposition‚Äîthe Queen invites him to put his legendary prowess to the test.

Featuring elegant pre-Code humor, suggestive double entendres, and dazzling musical numbers, this early Hollywood talkie is a prime example of the era‚Äôs risqu√© storytelling before the Production Code took over.

Also featuring Lupino Lane in a scene-stealing comic performance, The Love Parade (1929) is a classic musical filled with glamorous 1920s fashion, sumptuous Art Deco sets, and unforgettable melodies. Whether you love golden-age Hollywood, early musicals, or romantic comedies with vintage charm, this film is a must-watch.

Don‚Äôt miss this pre-code gem‚Äîwatch now and experience the irresistible magic of Old Hollywood at its most elegant and playful!

sources.title: The Love Parade (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. The Love Parade was a massive box office hit for Paramount Studios, and is one of the main reasons the studio was able to survive through the depression. It was nominated for six Academy Awards, although it won zero, and has nine songs that are unique to the picture. The comedy covers the marital problems of a queen and her consort, and audiences of the time were enraptured by the escapism.¬† Sourced from "PizzaFlix": https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rF29AkLjYio

metadata.Plot: Queen Louise's cabinet are worried that she will become an old maid, and are delighted when she marries the rougish Count Renard. Unfortunately, he finds his position as Queen's Consort unsatisfying and without purpose, and the marriage soon runs into difficulties.
metadata.Writer: Ernest Vajda, Guy Bolton, Leon Xanrof
metadata.Actors: Maurice Chevalier, Jeanette MacDonald, Lupino Lane
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 6 Oscars. 1 win & 6 nominations total
